txt.en: 'The large doors are locked tight, and will require the correct key to open'
'Here is a key I found...I believe it opens the large doors along the road. Please, hurry now!'
'Intolerable fools!'
The Northcotton Farm
'A few days ago, my friends and I smelled something delicious coming from this old farm.'
'I will not be defeated before my plan is complete! Darkthorn will spare none!'
'So we found a way into the farm and searched for the succulent aroma.'
'What did we find but tasty pies!'
'You have but a minute left, you pathetic creatures.'
'In mere moments, my destruction of the Shire will be complete.'
'After one bite, we found that they were not tasty at all. We were set unconscious!'
'I woke up hours later, trapped here all alone. Could you find and save my friends?'
'The cauldron boils...I hope you enjoy its bounty!'
'You have destroyed my cauldron, but you shall still feel my wrath.'
'Open the door! I cannot open it from this side.'
'I found this key...you may use it to open the doors ahead.'
'Why won't you open? I have lost my key and cannot pry the door open myself!'
'Open up in there! I cannot find the key. Do you hear me?'
'If you don't open this door, I will be trapped here without a key! Miserable rabble.'
'The cauldron has dumped its virulent poison into the well'
'Thadur has fled through the door, heading towards the centre of the farm'
'Ah, my uninvited guests. You shall now perish for your insolence.'
'The hobbit did not appear to be awakened from his trance.'
'...That pie is not tasty at all.'
You must have completed the 'Discovery: Northcotton Farms' deed to play this instance.
'This pie tastes off.'
You will need to <rgb=#FF0000>/slap</rgb> them out of it
'My Goodness, you are quite brave indeed.  Thank you for saving me.'
'Joyous day! A hobbit has fallen to my trap.'
'Look out! The fire is starting to cause the pot to boil over! Take a bucket of water and douse the fire!'
'Oh my goodness, thank you. This place is horrible.'
'Aid me my minions!'
'Sounds of bubbling and the smell of baked pie pass through the now open door'
'A hobbit has eaten a poison pie'
'Oh dear! Hungry hobbits have found their way in and are heading for the pies! Go over and slap them out of it.'
'Mmm...those pies smell delicious.'
'Those pies smell wonderful...I can't wait to take my first bite!'
'That was a pie gone bad....'
'After falling victim to one of those most dreadful pies, I awoke in the muddy boars' wallow.'
'The sweet, sweet smells of delicious pies call to me.'
'Luckily, these beasts were otherwise occupied with the goblins while I scurried up this tree.'
'Sadly, I have been here for some time, and I am ever so hungry.'
'I will wait up here until you brave folks go dispatch those scary goblins.'
'Oh! Here is a key I found, maybe it will be of some use.'
Legbarthil begins to lay an egg.
'Battle... Shadow... and Plague... all have returned! Many will die at Tirith dan Forduath!'
'Gladiola Farmer gives you a small key'
'Andy Boffin hands you a small key'
'Thy time is running out...my virulent brew is almost ready.'
'Oh goodness me! Thank you for vanquishing those horrible wolves.'
'Hooray! Thank you for saving me and the Shire!'
'Oh my! Do be careful. That icky cauldron is about to pour into the well. Please destroy it soon!'
'Oh dear, this place is simply dreadful!'
'When I first awoke, I heard the dark man say something about his useless goblin minions at the farmhouse.'
'Here is a key. It's one of two that's needed for the gate into the farmhouse.'
'Thank you so much for saving me from this dreadful place.'
'Isenbard Bolger hands you a key'
'Welcome, my friends. I bid you witness the poisoning of all those wretched halflings!'
'Too many hobbits have eaten poisoned pies'
'Crystal Bolger hands you a key to the main farmhouse door.'
'Success! My poison has been sent forth to destroy the Shire. You failed!'
'My Heroes! While falling prey to that dreadful pie, I heard a raspy voice talking to some goblins.'
'He said something about having something special in store for the Shire.'
'Goblins then began to drag in a horrible cauldron and raised it above the well. Mercy me, they must be stopped!'
